intro: Cotoneaster atuntzensis, commonly known as the Atuntzen cotoneaster, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rosaceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of South America, specifically the Andes in Chile and Argentina. This shrub typically grows to a height of 1 to 3 meters and produces small, red berries that are an important food source for local wildlife. The plant features simple, alternate leaves and is characterized by its clusters of white flowers that bloom in the spring. It is often found in rocky or semi-arid environments, thriving in well-drained soils.
